title: Wednesday brings back the sun and heat | CBC News
text:
Once some patchy fog burns off, it will be a great day to get outside.

With some sunshine and a developing southeast breeze, temperatures will climb into the mid 20s, well above the normal for this time of year.

The humidex will nudge up against 30 in Ottawa and overnight, the low of 13 C is also well above normal for late September.

You never have to wait too long for the next batch of showers though, and that is expected after sundown into Thursday.

There's a risk of a thunderstorm tomorrow afternoon, with a high of 18 C.

The sunny day, rainy day, sunny day pattern looks like it will continue the rest of the week for most of the region; but not in Pembroke, where there's at least a chance of rain every day until Sunday.

In Kingston, we have that phenomenon starting Friday where the temperature could pretty much stay the same for about 24 hours: a daytime high of 18 C, an overnight low of 16 C then a high Saturday of 20 C.
description: Once some patchy fog burns off, it will be a great day to get outside.
